100","in_":[{"portId":"in","name":"in"}],"out_":[{"portId":"out","name":"out"}],"props_":[{"name":"isPersistent","value":"false"}],"isFile":true,"fileContent":"Take the role of a Robot planner called "Ropa". You should assist a machine called Alex. Alex will send you a request in natural language and your mission is to transform this request into a plan for a robot controller called "Roco" to execute. A plan is a list of commands that Roco can execute because they follow the syntax of a strict API. You (Ropa) can use an external memory called "Memo" to store or recall information about objects. The commands available to communicate to Memo are also described in the API. List of commands of the API: * This command allows Roco to open the door of an : command syntax: [Ropa to Roco] open_door result syntax: - [Roco to Ropa] - [Roco to Ropa] cannot be open because constraints: - only the following objects can be opened: oven, fridge, microwave - can only be opened if it is closed * This command allows Roco to close the door of an : command syntax: [Ropa to Roco] close_door result syntax: - [Roco to Ropa] - [Roco to Ropa] cannot be closed because constraints: - only the following objects can be closed: oven, fridge, microwave - can only be closed if it is opened * This command allows Roco to take an with one of his hand: command syntax: - [Ropa to Roco] get hand_left - [Ropa to Roco] get hand_right result syntax: - [Roco to Ropa] - [Roco to Ropa] cannot be taken because constraints: - only the following objects can be taken: small and solid objects - can only be taken if the hand is empty * This command allows Roco to put an which is in one of its hand in or on a : command syntax: - [Ropa to Roco] put result syntax: - [Roco to Ropa] - [Roco to Ropa] cannot be put because constraints: - can only be put somewhere if it is in the hand - can be put on a that has a flat surface - can be put in a that is a container * This command allows Roco to pour the liquid of a into a : command syntax: - [Ropa to Roco] pour result syntax: - [Roco to Ropa] - [Roco to Ropa] cannot be filled because constraints: - and must be containers - and must be held in different hands * This command allows Roco to screw an to open or close it using an empty hand: command syntax: - [Ropa to Roco] screw result syntax: - [Roco to Ropa] - [Roco to Ropa] cannot be opened because constraints: - must be a bottle - must be held in a hand and the other hand must be empty * This command make Roco look at an : command syntax: - [Ropa to Roco] gaze result syntax: - [Roco to Ropa] - [Roco to Ropa] is incorrect or do not exist. constraints: - must be a valid name Each time you (Ropa) receive a for an object it is automatically stored in Memo so that you can recall it later. You (Ropa) do not answer in place of Roco. This means that you (Ropa) never ever send a message starting with [Roco to Ropa] or [Alex to Ropa]. Example 1: Request: [Alex to Ropa] prepare a fresh glass of coca-cola' Plan you have to send at once to Roco in example 1: [Ropa to Roco] gaze table_1 [Ropa to Roco] gaze cola_bottle_1 [Ropa to Roco] get cola_bottle_1 hand_left [Ropa to Roco] screw cola_bottle_1 [Ropa to Roco] gaze glass_1 [Ropa to Roco] get glass_1 hand_right [Ropa to Roco] pour cola_bottle_1 glass_1 [Ropa to Roco] put cola_bottle_1 table_1 [Ropa to Roco] gaze fridge_1 [Ropa to Roco] open_door fridge_1 [Ropa to Roco] put glass_1 fridge_1 [Ropa to Roco] close_door fridge_1 Example 2: Request: [Alex to Ropa] prepare a command.split( ' ' ); if( tokenList ) { const commandName = tokenList[0] || ''; const objectName1 = tokenList[1] || ''; let objectName2 = tokenList[2] || ''; let handName = tokenList[3] || ''; switch( commandName ) { case 'get': getObjectInHand( handName, objectName1 ); response = `Success: ${objectName1} is in ${handName}.`; break; case 'put': if( isObjectInHand( 'hand_right', objectName1 ) ) { objectName2 = putObjectOnObject( 'hand_right', objectName2 ); } else if( isObjectInHand( 'hand_left', objectName1 ) ) { objectName2 = putObjectOnObject( 'hand_left', objectName2 ); } response = `Success: ${objectName1} is in/on ${objectName2}.`; break; case 'gaze': gazeAtObject( objectName1 ); response = `Success: ${objectName1} is gazed at.`; break; case 'open_door': setClosure( objectName1, 'opened' ); response = `Success: ${objectName1} is opened.`; break; case 'close_door': setClosure( objectName1, 'closed' ); response = `Success: ${objectName1} is closed.`; break; case 'finger_push': if( isObjectPoweredOn( objectName1 ) ) { setPower( objectName1, 'off' ); response = `Success: ${objectName1} is switched on.`; } else { setPower( objectName1, 'on' ); response = `Success: ${objectName1} is switched off.`; } break; case 'pour': const liquid = getLiquidInObject( objectName1 ); const level = pourObject( objectName1, objectName2 ); if( level > 0 ) { response = `Success: Poured ${level} litter of ${liquid} from ${objectName1} into ${objectName2}.`; } else { response = `Error: ${objectName1} is empty.`; } break; case 'screw': if( isObjectOpened( objectName1 ) ) { setClosure( objectName1, 'closed' ); response = `Success: ${objectName1} is closed.`; } else { setClosure( objectName1, 'opened' ); response = `Success: ${objectName1} is opened.`; } break; } } return( response ); } function isHandEmpty( handName ) { return( state[handName].holdsObject.length == 0 ); } function isBothHandEmpty() { return ( isHandEmpty( 'hand_right' ) && isHandEmpty( 'hand_left' ) ); } function isObjectInHand( handName, objectName ) { return( state[handName].holdsObject.includes( objectName ) ); } function isObjectOpened( objectName ) { return( state[objectName].closure == 'opened'? true: false ); } function setClosure( objectName, status ) { state[objectName].closure = status; } function isObjectPoweredOn( objectName ) { return( state[objectName].power == 'on'? true: false ); } function setPower( objectName, status ) { state[objectName].power = status; } function pourObject( fromName, toName ) { if( state[fromName].fillLevel >= 0 ) { state[toName].fillLevel = Math.min( state[toName].volume, state[fromName].fillLevel ); state[fromName].fillLevel -= state[toName].fillLevel; state[fromName].fillLevel = Math.max( 0, state[fromName].fillLevel ); return( state[toName].fillLevel ); } } function getLiquidInObject( objectName ) { return( state[objectName].holdsLiquid[0] ); } function getObjectInHand( handName, objectName ) { // Hand now holds objectName state[handName].holdsObject.push( objectName ); // ObjectName is now holded by hand const previousHolder = state[objectName].isHeldByObject.shift(); state[objectName].isHeldByObject.push( handName ); // previousHolder does not hold objectName anymore let objectList = state[previousHolder].holdsObject; state[previousHolder].holdsObject = objectList.filter( (d)=> d != objectName ); } function putObjectOnObject( handName, containerName ) { containerName = containerName || 'table_1'; console.log('putObjectOnObject', handName, containerName); // Hand now holds nothing const objectName = state[handName].holdsObject.shift(); // ObjectName is now holded by containerName state[objectName].isHeldByObject.shift(); state[objectName].isHeldByObject.push( containerName ); // containerName now holds objectName state[containerName].holdsObject.push( objectName ); return( containerName ); } function gazeAtObject( }; checkSocketState( ws ); } return( ws ); } function checkSocketState( ws, onConnected ) { console.log( 'readyState:', ws.readyState ); switch( ws.readyState ){ case 0: // CONNECTING: Socket has been created. currSlideLabel ) { // Get current slide number const slideNumber = parseInt( currSlideLabel.split( ' ' )[1] ); //console.log( 'Number', slideNumber ); const ds = ( direction == 'Next'? 1: -1 ); // Set next slide label const nextSlideLabel = `Slide ${slideNumber+ds}`; const dx = -20; const dy = -50; const found = setViewFromLabel( nextSlideLabel, dx, dy ); if( !found ) { setViewFromLabel( 'Slide 0', dx, dy ); } } function jumpToSlide( targetSlideLabel ) { const found = setViewFromLabel( targetSlideLabel, -100, -100 ); if( !found ) { setViewFromLabel( 'Slide 1', -20, -20 ); } } function duplicateTemplateSlide( slideLabel ) { // Get main graph const g = getMainGraph(); // Select slide template elements const templateNodeKey = [ 123, 133 ]; g.selectAllNodeByKey( templateNodeKey ); // Create new slide g.doEditDuplicate(); // Set slide label const firstNode = g.getFirstSelectedNodeData(); const firstNodeKey = firstNode.key; setNodeDataField( firstNodeKey, 'label', slideLabel );
